item.title: Vitamin D is indispensable for the health of women - editorial
item.description:
• Vitamin D for Clinical Diseases in Women: An Indispensable Factor in Medicine and Dentistry

Vitamin D for Clinical Diseases in Women: An Indispensable Factor in Medicine and Dentistry

J. Clin. Med. 2022, 11, 3104. https://doi.org/10.3390/jcm11113104

Dario Calafiore * , Leonzio Fortunato 2© and Mario Migliario 3,*

  1. Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation Unit, Department of Neurosciences, ASST Carlo Poma, 46100 Mantova, Italy

  2. Dentistry Unit, Department of Health Sciences, University of Catanzaro “Magna Graecia”,88100 Catanzaro, Italy; leo@unicz.it

item.title: Vitamin D fights Coronary Artery Disease in many ways – when will it be used in therapy
item.description:
• Low levels of vitamin D and coronary artery disease: Is it time for therapy?

Low levels of vitamin D and coronary artery disease: Is it time for therapy?

Kardiol Pol. 2022;80(4):409-416. doi: 10.33963/KP.a2022.0079.

Monica Verdoia 1 2, Rocco Gioscia 1, Matteo Nardin 3, Andrea Rognoni 1 2, Giuseppe De Luca 4

Vitamin D and atherosclerosis: mechanistic links

The association between vitamin D and the prevalence and severity of coronary artery disease (CAD), major established cardiovascular risk factors, and acute ischemic events has been consistently demonstrated in large-scale observational studies and meta-analyses, with relevant prognostic implications. The rise in prevalence of hypovitaminosis D in recent years, reaching pandemic pro-portions, has pointed to the importance of the identification and optimization of the indications and strategies for the therapeutic use of vitamin D, with particular relevance for cardiovascular health. However, vitamin D supplementation has provided so far inconsistent results in primary prevention, with even fewer data reported in patients with established CAD. The present review aims to provide an updated overview of the available evidence and potential therapeutic applications of vitaminD in patients with CAD.

item.title: The Role of Magnesium in the Pathogenesis of Metabolic Disorders
item.description:
• The Role of Magnesium in the Pathogenesis of Metabolic Disorders
      • Chart Magnesium and metabolic disorders
      • Magnesium and High Cholesterol Meta-analyses

The Role of Magnesium in the Pathogenesis of Metabolic Disorders

Nutrients 2022, 14(9), 1714; https://doi.org/10.3390/nu14091714

by Marta Pelczyńska *ORCID,Małgorzata MoszakORCID and Paweł BogdańskiORCID

Department of Treatment of Obesity, Metabolic Disorders and Clinical Dietetics, Poznań University of Medical Sciences, 84 Szamarzewskiego Street, 60-569 Poznań, Poland

Magnesium (Mg) is an essential nutrient for maintaining vital physiological functions. It is involved in many fundamental processes, and Mg deficiency is often correlated with negative health outcomes. On the one hand, most western civilizations consume less than the recommended daily allowance of Mg. On the other hand, a growing body of evidence has indicated that chronic hypomagnesemia may be implicated in the pathogenesis of various metabolic disorders such as

item.title: Vitamin C
item.description:
It appears that Vitamin C needs to be taken orally many times a day to be useful
   It is similar to vitamin C injections

      • What are the benefits of liposomal vitamin C over standard vitamin C? asked Perplexity AI - Dec 2024
      • Vitamin C needed to precent and treat Cancer - March 2024
      • Vitamin C—Sources, Physiological Role, Kinetics, Deficiency, Use, Toxicity, and Determination - Feb 2021
      • Neuroprotective properties of vitamin C: A Scoping Review of pre-clinical and clinical studies - Feb 2021
      • The Role of Vitamin C in Two Distinct Physiological States: Physical Activity and Sleep - Dec 2020
      • Mortality in septic patients treated with vitamin C: a systematic meta-analysis Jan 2021
      • Vitamin C and Immune Function - Nov 2017
      • Special issue on Vitamin C in Nutrients - 2017 (15 studies)
      • Vitamin C consumption has decreased
      • Vitamin C books (have not looked at them)
      • The Ultimate Vitamin C Crash Course - Collagen, Hormones, Chemistry & More - video Aug 2019
      • Vitamin C category is associated with: Virus 25, Zinc 20, Magnesium, 11, Vitamin K 9, Vitamin A 8, Resveratrol 8, Supplement 7, Vitamin B12 7, Boron, 6, Omega-3 6, Calcium 6, Iron 4, Iodine 4, Curcumin 4

What are the benefits of liposomal vitamin C over standard vitamin C? asked Perplexity AI - Dec 2024

Liposomal vitamin C offers several significant advantages over standard vitamin C supplements, primarily due to its enhanced absorption and bioavailability. Here are the key benefits of liposomal vitamin C compared to standard forms:

item.title: Vitamin B12
item.description:
• Summary of this page by Claude-2 - A Large Language Model (AI) Aug 2023
      • Asked: Apparently, there are two forms of Vitamin B-12. How are they different (Perplexity AI April 2024)
      • Reddit has an FAQ on B-12
      • The Essential Guide for Vitamin B12! - Dr. Osborne’s Zone - video April 2024
      • Founder of VitaminDWiki was noticing low energy, B-12 helped a lot - Aug 2023
      • WARNING: Combined B12 & B6 found to increase risk of hip fracture by 47 percent - 2019
      • Vitamin B12 is strongly recommended in the Coimbra Protocol for Multiple Sclerosis & Autoimmune
    • Vitamin B12 on the web
      • Content of B-12 etc in Nutrional Yeast - 2020
      • B12 blood tests: at home, blood test services: sometimes combined with Vitamin D test
      • 47 Vitamin B12 videos by Dr. Greger (typically 5 minutes, with transcripts & references)
      • The Symptoms of Vitamin B12 Deficiency and Optimal Dosage for Adults - Dr. Greger - Aug 2023
      • About 1,000 micrograms of B12 =little change in Cognition, Depression, Fatigue - Meta-analysis March 2021
      • B12 supplementation improved cognition (MMSE) in 3 months - Feb 2020
      • 5X difference in B-12 bioavailability (emulsion best)
      • B12 use both before and during Breast Cancer chemotherapy DECREASED survival by 1.8 X - 2019
      • 11 symptoms of B12 deficiency - Jan 2019
      • Brain Shrinkage 6X more likely if low B-12 - 2008** Vitamin B12 status and rate of brain volume loss in community-dwelling elderly. **doi: 10.1212/01.wnl.0000325581.26991.f2
      • Misconceptions about a B12 deficiency - 2017?** Misconceptions about a B12 deficiency **** Summary points **1. Serum B12 is a conclusive test
      • Seniors needed 1000 ug of B12 tablet form (which is the least bio-available) - 2005** Older Adults May Need B12 Dose More Than 200 Times the RDA to Normalize Mild Vitamin Deficiency Medscape 2005 *** Randomized Controlled trial using 2.5, 100, 250, 500, and 1,000 µg
      • http://www.b12-vitamin.com
      • B12 - a huge resource of information
      • Wikipedia** B12 Deficiency **—
      • B12 infographics from the web
      • A Proven Sign Of Vitamin B12 Deficiency June 2019** SPRING *** “Around one-quarter of people may have a vitamin B12 deficiency.”
      • Low B12 in 55% of Diabetics getting Metformin - 2018
      • B12 supplementation may treat T2 Diabetes - Oct 2022** The efficacy of vitamin B12 supplementation for treating vitamin B12 deficiency and peripheral neuropathy in metformin-treated type 2 diabetes mellitus patients: A systematic review **https://doi.org/10.1016/j.dsx.2022.102634
      • B12 oral seems as good as an injection, and much lower cost - Cochraine March 2018** Oral vitamin B12 versus intramuscular vitamin B12 for vitamin B12 deficiency **10.1002/14651858.CD004655.pub3 PDF
      • B12. - March 2018
      • 3X as many headaches in children with low B12 - March 2018
      • Singers believe B12 reduces voice tremors - Jan 2018
      • Nineteen B12 genes - Feb 2018
      • B12 deficiency - from Pintrest
      • B12 injections increase acne
      • Why Most People Need Vitamin B12 Supplementation - 3 Mercola items** Why Most People Need Vitamin B12 Supplementation April 2018, 50-minute video *** 40 % have marginal vitamin B12, 9 % are deficient
      • Tested German pregnancies for 27 deficiencies, B-12 deficiency was found most frequently - June 2018** High incidence of maternal vitamin B12 deficiency detected by newborn screening: first results from a study for the evaluation of 26 additional target disorders for the German newborn screening panel. **DOI: 10.1007/s12519-018-0159-1
      • 80 % of those within neurological abnormalities were B12 deficient - June 2018** Vitamin B12 deficiency neuropathy: A clinical and electrophysiological study **Neurophysiologie Clinique. Volume 48, Issue 3, June 2018, Page 130. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.neucli.2018.05.00
      • Images from the web
      • Evolutionary Quirk- Discover Magazine Aug 2018** The Evolutionary Quirk That Made Vitamin B12 Part of Our Diet **** B12 made in the human gut is further down than it can be absorbed **—
      • Vitamin B-12 – little extra benefit if more than 5 micrograms at a time (orally)
      • How common is vitamin B-12 deficiency? - 2009
      • B12 Lifetime trends
      • 3 out of 4 Vegans are deficient, 1 out of 4 elderly
      • Very large doses do result in more getting into the blood
      • Females may have less B12 if older than 12 years, especially Black females
      • B-12 and Vitamin D reduce cardiovascular mortality - Dec 2018** Recent Insights into the Role of Vitamin B12 and Vitamin D upon Cardiovascular Mortality: A Systematic Review {FONT(size=“16”)} Download the PDF from VitaminDWiki **{FONT}
      • Oral B12 was 1.8X better than Injection - Jan 2019
      • B12 needed to fight pathogens (in roundworms) March 2019** Rice University Press Release **Roundworms and humans both need B-12 in diet, both suffer from the same pathogen
      • B12 eliminated canker sores in 74% of people - RCT 2009** Effectiveness of Vitamin B12 in Treating Recurrent Aphthous Stomatitis: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Trial **sublingual 1000 mcg of vitamin B12 for 6 months
      • B12 deficiency and clinical laboratory: Lessons revisited and clarified in seven questions - Sept 2017
      • 5 5 minute B12 videos by Dr. Greger Oct 2020
      • B12 deficiency is sometimes associated with poor cognition, taking B12 reduced their cognitive problems - Feb 2021
      • Some additional studies of low B12 and poor cognition
      • Metformin (oral glucose-lowering drug) causes B12 deficiency - July 2021** Long-term metformin therapy and vitamin B12 deficiency: An association to bear in mind **DOI: 10.4239/wjd.v12.i7.916 FREE PDF
      • Unraveling The Complexity Of Vitamin B12 Diseases - Jan 2022** ScienceBlog Baylor University **Tackling the complexity of two inherited vitamin B12 diseases
      • Vitamin B-12 and the Gastrointestinal Microbiome - March 2022** A Systematic Review **behind paywall https://doi.org/10.1093/advances/nmab123
    • Other B Vitamins
      • B Vitamins at Mercola Sept 2018** “The Power of Bioavailable B Vitamins – What Could Your Life Look Like If You Had More?” **||B Vitamin | Recommended Adult Daily Intake | Susceptibility to damage during processing and storage | Important Functions
    • Prescribing vitamin B complex: Need for reassessment - June 2021

Summary of this page by Claude-2 - A Large Language Model (AI) Aug 2023

Vitamin B12, also known as cobalamin, is an essential nutrient that plays important roles in red blood cell formation, cell metabolism, nerve function, and DNA synthesis. The PDF provides an overview of vitamin B12, including deficiency symptoms, optimal dosages, dietary sources, reasons people may need supplementation, and more.

item.title: Zinc and Vitamin D
item.description:
It appears that

  • Low Zinc results in less vitamin D in blood getting to tissues

  • Colds can be stopped by taking Zinc every 2-3 hours

    • COVID-19 risks appear to decrease by taking Zinc frequently

  • Zinc improves the immune system and influences 300 enzymes

  • Zinc deficiency has increased due to lack of Zinc in fertilizers as well as Roundup problems

  • 20% of the people in the world do not get enough Zinc

item.title: Cystic Fibrosis
item.description:
• Cystic fibrosis (CF) is a genetic disorder that affects the lungs, pancreas, and other organs, leading to severe respiratory and digestive problems.

  • 162,428 people are living with CF around the world.

  • 105,352 (65%) have been diagnosed

  • 57,076 individuals undiagnosed (Summary by Perplexity AI - March 2024)

      • Oral vitamin D helps cystic fibrosis - meta-analysis Jan 2024
      • CF treated by Vitamins D, A, C, E, and zinc, omega-3 (DHA), garlic, ginseng and curcumin - Mercola May 2024
      • Cystic Fibrosis treatment Trikafta costs $300,000/year - March 2024
      • Google Scholar had 371 studies with CF and Vitamin D in their title as of March 2025
      • See also WikiPedia
      • UK Cystic Fibrosis recommendations to be released in 2017
      • Average annual cost of CF = $16,000 (March 2013)
      • Role of vitamin D on gut microbiota in cystic fibrosis - 2018
      • CF results in pancreatic insufficiency-induced malabsorption - which reduces the response to standard Vitamin D - Jan 2021

Oral vitamin D helps cystic fibrosis - meta-analysis Jan 2024

Vitamin D deficiency in patients with cystic fibrosis: a systematic review and meta-analysis

item.title: Trauma and surgery
item.description:
• High Dose Vitamin D in the (COVID) ICU - video May 2023

High Dose Vitamin D in the (COVID) ICU - video May 2023

Dr. Eduardo Beltran

In this video, we shall talk about HLD (600K IU of vitamin D3) that was used in the intensive care unit (Brazil & Bolivia) used in patients who were diagnosed with SCV-2. Patients received their D3 via an NG tube while being intubated and connected to a ventilator. 26 out of 28 patients survived. The results speak for themselves.

item.title: Overview UV and vitamin D
item.description:
• Consensus
      • Confusion/Disagreement
      • Spectrum
      • UVB and UVA are very different
      • UV: Different Spectra: UVB = Vitamin D, UVA = Pigmentations
      • Hypothesis: UVA decreases vitamin D: many hints
      • Measure UV
      • UV thru glass
      • No UVB (Vitamin D) gets thru, but most UVA (Tan) gets thru
      • Sunscreens
      • Increased sunscreen ==> increased melanoma
      • Red = sunlight; other lines = amount of light filtered thru sunscreens
      • See also web

Consensus

  • UV radiation at the ground consists mainly of UVA, some UVB, and a tiny amount of UVC

    • UV used by Olympic athletes since the 1930’s, High UV in Mexico Olympics broke many records

  • Professional sports team takes 5000 IU vitamin D and wins championship Hockey

item.title: Overview Magnesium and vitamin D
item.description:
• Summary by Chat-GPT Deep Research as of Feb 27, 2025
    • Magnesium by itself helps with various health problems
      • Magnesium and Hypertension - FDA allows claim as of Jan 2022
      • Magnesium deficiency is associated with poor mental health
      • Reduce stress and anxiety with Magnesium - 100-page ebook June 2017
      • National Library of Medicine effectiveness ratings for MAGNESIUM (with no comment on vitamin D)
      • Magnesium 101 (2014)
      • Magnesium is one of the treatments for Restless Legs
      • 32 SIGNS YOU IMMEDIATELY NEED MORE MAGNESIUM
      • Hot Flashes and Magnesium
      • Are You Getting Enough Magnesium? - AARP Feb 2018
    • Magnesium supplements
      • Many Magnesium supplements errored on amount or type - video March 2025
      • % Magnesium element in supplements
      • Consumer Lab Review of Magnesium - as little as 2 cents per 200 mg of Mg
      • Magnesium Chloride
      • Magnesium acetyl taurate best in rat study - 2019
      • Citrate good, Oxide not better than placebo - RCT 2003
      • Much more heart disease if the Calcium/Magnesium ratio is too high
      • Magnesium-related diseases
    • Magnesium Bioavailability
      • Bioavailability and Pharmacokinetics of Magnesium - 2001
      • Magnesium may not be as available if you have low stomach acid (seniors)
      • Apparently, probiotics improve Mg absorption; no clue as to what type, how many CFUs, and by how much
      • Pros and cons of various Magnesium compounds - Jan 2017
      • Bioavailability - from a forum
    • Magnesium in the diet
      • Magnesium in the diet
      • British Analysis of Mineral Content for Vegetables** from PDF, which is attached at the bottom of this page **
      • US Govt study of Mineral Content for a century did not change much
      • The Scientific Evidence of Mineral Deficiency in Food
      • Cost of food to get 400 mg Magnesium
      • Excellent review of Magnesium Supplementation and Benefits at Consumer Labs - updated Feb 2023
    • Magnesium Deficiency
      • 36+ reasons for low Magnesium** 1) Diseases associated with Hypmagnesia **Diabetes
      • Decrease in Magnesium during the past century.
      • Magnesium levels fall with chemos, PPI - May 2023
      • Reasons for Magnesium Deficiency include
      • Most people are Magnesium Deficient
      • Reasons for Magnesium Deficiency - from Metabolics.com
    • How much Magnesium
      • What’s The RIGHT Magnesium Dosage For Optimal Health?
      • The upper limit is for supplements onlyand is less than the RDA
      • Magnesium Requirements
    • Magnesium tests** Magnesium test of your blood $49 (not cell test) - (price checked May 2022)
    • Magnesium and Vitamin D
      • Magnesium and Vitamin D - similarities and differences
      • The chart shows 3 locations where low Magnesium decreases Vitamin D
      • Mg and Vitamin D 37 minute video - Aug 2024
      • Vitamin D and Magnesium are similar Life Extension Mag - Dec 2016
      • Updates
    • Other
      • Great summary by “Ms. Magnesium” (Dr. C Dean) March 2015
      • Mercola has many articles on Magnesium
      • VitaminDWiki Low cost to get vitamin D cofactors - including Magnesium
      • Mineral decrease from vegetables in the past century
      • My notes of the book Magnesium Miracle by C. Dean 2007 – need to be confirmed.
      • Magnesium L-Threonate – perhaps more bioavailable – Jan 2012
      • Magnesium compounds have similar bioavailability - 2005
      • Magnesium in water is associated with a reduction in stroke
      • Magnesium online resource center
      • Magnesium Interactions
      • The only difference between chlorophyll and hemoglobin is that Magnesium is in the center instead of Iron
      • 3,751 magnesium binding sites on human proteins GreenMedInfo Dec 2012
      • See also web
      • Infographic by Ontario Health
      • Magnesium Reduces Diabetes Risk by 53% Report on a 2013 study
      • Notes on what needs to be made into a summary/introduction (May 2022)
      • Extensive Overview of all Health and Magnesium by Examine - July 2024
      • Extensive Overview of Magnesium at Pauling Institute - updated Nov 2018
      • It appears that ALL forms of Magnesium cross the blood-brain barrier
      • Overview of Transdermal/Topical Magnesium Chloride - 2017

Summary by Chat-GPT Deep Research as of Feb 27, 2025

Magnesium: Overview of Benefits, Deficiency, Dosage, and Interactions

item.title: Overview Vitamin K and Vitamin D
item.description:
Vitamin K2 is similar to D3 in many ways

  1. Both vitamins were initially confused with its lesser form (D2 ==> D3, K1 ==> K2)

  2. Both vitamins appear to influence health in large number of ways

  3. Both vitamins in the body are about 1/10 that of a century ago

Example: Grass-fed beef has a lot more K2, D3, and Magnesium

  1. Need very little of both vitamins: <1 milligram daily

item.title: Overview Obesity and Vitamin D
item.description:
• Noteworthy Obesity pages - Oct 2019 - Nov 2024
      • See also VitaminDWiki and weight loss due to vitamins and/or Calcium/Milk
      • Clinical trials of Obese or Overweight and Vitamin D INTERVENTION 204 trials listed as of April 2025
      • See also VitaminDWiki and weight loss due to vitamin D and Magnesium
      • Obesity is a VERY COMPLEX topic
      • Overview of Deficiency at VitaminDWiki includes Obesity vicious circles
      • Epidemic of obesity started same time as many other epidemics,
      • US Obesity increased after Food guidelines were changed - Mercola
      • BMI increase 1980-2008 (nothing about vitamin D) - 2015
      • decrease in vitamin D with increasing BMI
      • Obesity is a Global epidemic
      • Institute of Medicine issued a report: Obesity in America - May 2012
      • Increased Calorie consumption over the decades
      • Increased vitamin D-binding protein and decreased free 25(OH)D in obese women of reproductive age - 2013
      • Mexico takes title of “most obese” from America CBS News July 2013
      • One in Five American Deaths Associated with Obesity in 2006 Mercola, Dec 2013
      • Should we stop calling obesity a disease? Cracking Health Care Costs, Feb 2014
      • AMA finally recommends no longer relying on BMI to determine obesity - 2023
      • GLP-1 weight-loss drugs (Wegovy etc): huge market, many competitors coming, many side effects, possible other uses - April 2024
      • BMI - what is wrong with it NY Times - April 2014
      • Obesity costs the global economy as much as war and terrorism, totalling $2 TRILLION each year Nov 2014
      • Obesity Gene (FTO) was not a problem for people born before WWII NYT Jan 2014
      • BMI in Profile
      • 98% of severely obese had low levels of vitamin D - June 2015
      • Health problems associated with excess weight
      • Following Bariatric Surgery for obesity - special supplementation concerns
      • The more obese the man, the sooner he will die - 2016
      • 8 of the top 10 obese countries are Muslim From WikiIslam, the online resource on Islam - 2017
      • Health Effects of Overweight and Obesity
      • A UK region no longer will provide surgery to smokers or very obese (BMI>40) - Oct 2017
      • Being Overweight/Obese become the new norm, fewer people are trying to lose weight - 2017
      • CDC US Obesity maps 1994, 2015

Noteworthy Obesity pages - Oct 2019 - Nov 2024

  • 40% of weight loss from GLP-1 is from muscle loss (not so if lose weight with Vitamin D) - Nov 2024

item.title: Overview Parkinson's and Vitamin D
item.description:
• See also on VitaminDWiki
      • Those with PD have 7X higher/lower amounts of certain gut bacteria - Jan 2023
      • Candidate nutraceuticals to fight PD (Oct 2022)
      • Parkinson’s incidence increase 10 X in 60 years
      • See also on web
      • Vitamin D Deficiency-Induced Vertebral Fractures May Cause Stooped Posture in Parkinson Disease - 2011
      • Age-Adjusted death from Parkinson’s
      • High prevalence of hypovitaminosis D status in patients with early Parkinson disease.
      • Remember Vitamin D to forget Parkinson’s disease July 2012
      • Parkinson’s may be an Autoimmune Disease (data since 2017)
      • What is Parkinson’s (From MJ Fox)
      • Emerging role of Nutrition in PD - vitamin D and Omega-3 are mentioned - 2014
      • Risk of Dementia reduced 50% by just using Brain Plasticity Software for just 13 hours - Nov 2017
      • PD rehabilitation better with Virtual Reality - Review April 2021
      • Excess Manganese increases the Risk of Parkinson’s Symptoms (first described in 1837)
